methods.Synopsis: Returns information on Sentinel users the current user can manage

parameters.Name: accept_fmt
parameters.Description: text/csv - provides a list with the following items - username, role, sites (I think), and what I'm guessing is company (WhiteHat). application/json - returns user and sub-user info (only seeing user info, guessing there are no sub-users setup.), including user capabilities. text/xmll - same as application/json, except without user capabilities.

methods.Synopsis: Returns information on sites user has access to

parameters.Name: query_weight
parameters.Description: Limited range: 0 to 10

parameters.Name: query_speed
parameters.Description: Format: unnecessary-number.number, guess minutes.seconds

parameters.Name: display_all
parameters.Description: A meta-parameter which exposes all of the properties which may be exposed by display parameters.

parameters.Name: display_min
parameters.Description: A meta-parameter which exposes only the label and id properties of the Site resource. This parameter is lowest precedence and so other display parameters may be used to expose specific properties.

parameters.Name: display_entry_points_content
parameters.Description: Display request content for POST entry points.

parameters.Name: display_scan_status
parameters.Description: Expose a list of scan related indicators as a property on the Site resource. These flags indicate whether scans are running properly and whether user action is required to make scans run.

parameters.Name: display_groups
parameters.Description: Expose a list of groups to which the site belongs as a property of the Site resource

parameters.Name: display_vuln_stats
parameters.Description: Expose simple statistics about the number of vulns on the Site.

parameters.Name: display_vuln_policy
parameters.Description: Expose 'vuln_policy' as an object property of the Site resource which refers to the Vulnerability Policy currently applied to the site.

parameters.Name: display_assessment_complete
parameters.Description: Expose 'assessment_complete' as a boolean property of the Site resource which indicates whether there are outstanding vulnerabilities under assessment. A false value indicates that either scanning or evaluation is incomplete.

parameters.Name: display_entry_points
parameters.Description: Entry points are starting point URLs for scan crawling. Setting this option will include a list of entry points as a property of the Site resource.

parameters.Name: display_site_credentials
parameters.Description: Expose a list of site credentials which may be used to log into the site under test. These are represented in plain text in order to allow for automated processes. It is recommended that sensitive credentials not be used for this purpose.

parameters.Name: display_allowed_hosts
parameters.Description: Expose a list of allowed hosts as a property of the Site resource. Allowed hosts are hosts other than the site_url which are allowed be scanned as a part of a Site.

parameters.Name: display_scan_schedule
parameters.Description: Expose the scan schedule which indicates when automated scanning will take place.

parameters.Name: page:limit
parameters.Description: Limit results to n number of pages.

parameters.Name: page:offset
parameters.Description: Begin showing results from page number n.

parameters.Name: page:order_by
parameters.Description: Order the results.

parameters.Description: Selects the requested response representation format.

parameters.Name: query_threat

parameters.Name: query_start_date
parameters.Description: Query for results after the given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_end_date
parameters.Description: Query for results before the given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_site
parameters.Description: Query by site id or site label. | stub

parameters.Name: query_status
parameters.Description: May be 'open','closed', 'certified', or some combination of the three. Ex. - "open, closed" | stub

parameters.Name: query_class
parameters.Description: Query by the short or long vulnerability classification name. | stub

parameters.Name: query_found
parameters.Description: Query for results found since a given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601  (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_opened
parameters.Description: Query for results opened since a given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_closed
parameters.Description: Query for results closed since a given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_url
parameters.Description: Provide some portion of a url to search for. Ex. - Entering "testsite" will return any vulnerability with a url containing the string "testsite". | stub

parameters.Name: query_tags
parameters.Description: Search tags | stub

parameters.Name: query_tag_search_type
parameters.Description: Changes the behavior of query_tags when more than one tag is specified. If it's 'all' then all tags must be present to match, 'none' no tags must match, 'any' any tag may match. | stub

parameters.Name: display_vulnerability
parameters.Description: Display vulnervailities. | stub

parameters.Name: display_attack_vectors

parameters.Name: display_attack_vectors_notes
parameters.Description: Display attack vector notes in full. | stub

parameters.Name: display_attack_vectors_flagged
parameters.Description: If attack vector is flagged, will display flag. | stub

parameters.Name: display_description
parameters.Description: Display general information about vulnerability. 'custom' option will display custom descriptions. | stub

parameters.Name: display_solution
parameters.Description: Display general vulnerability solution information. 'custom' option will display custom solutions. | stub

parameters.Description: Display Q & A | stub

parameters.Description: Display request information. | stub

parameters.Name: display_headers
parameters.Description: Dependent upon display_request and display_response. If either is not chosen, respective headers will not be displayed. | stub

parameters.Name: display_abbr
parameters.Description: Display an abbreviated match as part of the response content. [NOT SURE IF WORKING] | stub

parameters.Name: display_stats
parameters.Description: Display statistics for all user-accessible sites. | stub

parameters.Description: Dependent upon display_request, if display_request is not '1', then display_param will not be shown. | stub

parameters.Description: Dependent upon display_request and display_response. If either is not chosen, respective headers will not be displayed. | stub

parameters.Name: display_abbr
parameters.Description: Display an abbreviated match as part of the response content. [NOT SURE IF WORKING] | stub

parameters.Name: display_stats
parameters.Description: Display statistics for all user-accessible sites. | stub

parameters.Name: display_param
parameters.Description: Dependent upon display_request, if display_request is not '1', then display_param will not be shown. | stub

parameters.Name: display_has_notes
parameters.Description: Displays whether notes exist for vulnerabilities and attack vectors. | stub

parameters.Name: display_cvss
parameters.Description: Displays cvss_score and cvss_vector (What are those?) | stub

parameters.Name: display_tags
parameters.Description: Display tags. | stub

parameters.Name: page:limit
parameters.Description: Limit results to n number of pages.

parameters.Name: page:offset
parameters.Description: Begin showing results from page number n.

parameters.Name: page:order_by
parameters.Description: Order the results.

methods.MethodName: Get specific attack vector for specific vulnerability

parameters.Name: vuln_proto_id
parameters.Description: Vulnerability id | stub

parameters.Name: attack_vector_id
parameters.Description: Attack vector sub resource id | stub

parameters.Name: query_threat
parameters.Description: One value or multiple comma seperated values. Threats have the following range: 1 to 5 | stub

parameters.Name: query_score
parameters.Description: One value or multiple comma seperated values. Scores have the following range: 3 to 15 | stub

parameters.Name: query_severity
parameters.Description: One value or multiple comma seperated values. Severity have the following range: 1 to 5 | stub

parameters.Name: query_start_date
parameters.Description: Query for results after the given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_end_date
parameters.Description: Query for results before the given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_site
parameters.Description: Query by site id or site label. | stub

parameters.Name: query_status
parameters.Description: May be 'open','closed', 'certified', or some combination of the three. Ex. - "open, closed" | stub

parameters.Name: query_class
parameters.Description: Query by the short or long vulnerability classification name. | stub

parameters.Name: query_found
parameters.Description: Query for results found since a given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601  (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_opened
parameters.Description: Query for results opened since a given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_closed
parameters.Description: Query for results closed since a given date. Date format: Valid ISO8601 (that means UTC (aka GMT)) (Ex. 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' -> '2008-12-12T21:35:59Z') | stub

parameters.Name: query_url
parameters.Description: Provide some portion of a url to search for. Ex. - Entering "testsite" will return any vulnerability with a url containing the string "testsite". | stub

parameters.Name: query_tags
parameters.Description: Search tags | stub

parameters.Name: query_tag_search_type
parameters.Description: Changes the behavior of query_tags when more than one tag is specified. If it's 'all' then all tags must be present to match, 'none' no tags must match, 'any' any tag may match. | stub
